Impact Package¶

Submodules¶

impact_utils.anomaly_detection module¶

Anomaly Detection¶

This module provides functions for detecting anomalies in time series data.

impact_utils.anomaly_detection.detect_anomalies(data, contamination=0.1)[source]¶

Detect anomalies in the given data using Isolation Forest.

Parameters: data (array-like): The input data for anomaly detection. contamination (float): The proportion of outliers in the data set.

Returns: array: A boolean array indicating whether each point is an anomaly.

impact_utils.change_detection module¶

This module contains functions for detecting changepoints and calculating percent change in time series data.

impact_utils.change_detection.calculate_percent_change(data)[source]¶

Calculate percent change in time series data.

Parameters:

data (pd.Series) – Time series data.

Returns:

Percent change values.

Return type:

pd.Series

impact_utils.change_detection.detect_changepoints(data, threshold=1.5)[source]¶

Detect changepoints in time series data.

Parameters:

  • data (array-like) – Time series data.

  • threshold (float) – Threshold for detecting changepoints.

Returns:

Indices of detected changepoints.

Return type:

np.ndarray

impact_utils.experimentation module¶

impact_utils.experimentation.experiment_with_models(data, features, target, models)[source]¶

Experiment with different models on the provided dataset.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Dataset containing features and target.

  • features (list) – List of feature column names.

  • target (str) – Target column name.

  • models (dict) – Dictionary of models to experiment with.

Returns:

DataFrame containing model performance metrics.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

impact_utils.experimentation.feedback_loop(model, new_data, actuals)[source]¶

Update model based on new data and actual values.

Parameters:

  • model (object) – Trained model instance.

  • new_data (pd.DataFrame) – New data for making predictions.

  • actuals (pd.Series) – Actual values for the new data.

Returns:

Mean squared error after the update.

Return type:

float

impact_utils.impact_analysis module¶

This module contains functions for impact analysis, including Difference-in-Differences (DiD) and Instrumental Variables (IV) methods.

impact_utils.impact_analysis.difference_in_differences(before_treatment, after_treatment, before_control, after_control)[source]¶

Calculate the treatment effect using Difference-in-Differences (DiD).

Parameters: before_treatment (array-like): Outcome values for the treatment group before the treatment. after_treatment (array-like): Outcome values for the treatment group after the treatment. before_control (array-like): Outcome values for the control group before the treatment. after_control (array-like): Outcome values for the control group after the treatment.

Returns: float: Estimated treatment effect.

impact_utils.impact_analysis.instrumental_variables(y, x, z)[source]¶

Estimate the causal effect using Instrumental Variables (IV).

Parameters: y (array-like): Dependent variable. x (array-like): Endogenous explanatory variable. z (array-like): Instrumental variable.

Returns: model: Fitted IV model.

impact_utils.predictive_maintenance module¶

Predictive Maintenance¶

This module provides functions for predictive maintenance.

impact_utils.predictive_maintenance.predict_failure(model, new_data)[source]¶

Predict failure using the trained model.

Parameters:

  • model (object) – Trained model instance.

  • new_data (pd.DataFrame) – New data for making predictions.

Returns:

Predicted failure probabilities.

Return type:

np.ndarray

impact_utils.predictive_maintenance.train_predictive_model(data, target)[source]¶

Train a predictive maintenance model using RandomForest.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing features and target.

  • target (str) – Target column name.

Returns:

Trained RandomForest model.

Return type:

model

impact_utils.technical_indicators module¶

This module contains functions for calculating technical indicators such as the Stochastic Oscillator and Relative Strength Index (RSI).

impact_utils.technical_indicators.relative_strength_index(data, window)[source]¶

Calculate the Relative Strength Index (RSI).

Parameters:

  • data – Time series data.

  • window – Window size for RSI calculation.

Returns:

Relative Strength Index values.

Return type:

rsi

impact_utils.technical_indicators.stochastic_oscillator(data, k_window, d_window)[source]¶

Calculate the stochastic oscillator.

Parameters:

  • data – Time series data.

  • k_window – Window size for %K calculation.

  • d_window – Window size for %D calculation.

Returns:

Stochastic oscillator %K and %D values.

Return type:

k_values, d_values

impact_utils.trend_analysis module¶

This module contains functions for trend analysis in time series data.

impact_utils.trend_analysis.decompose_time_series(data)[source]¶

Decompose time series into seasonal, trend, and residual components.

Parameters:

data (pd.Series) – Time series data.

Returns:

Trend, seasonal, and residual components of the time series.

Return type:

tuple

impact_utils.trend_analysis.detect_trend(data)[source]¶

Detect trend in time series data.

Parameters:

data (pd.Series) – Time series data.

Returns:

Trend component of the data.

Return type:

pd.Series
